sect1.title: Pseudo-types and variables used in this documentation
sect1.para: Pseudo-types are keywords used in the PHP documentation to specify the types or values an argument can have. Please note that they are not primitives of the PHP language. So you cannot use pseudo-types as typehints in your own custom functions.

sect2.title: mixed
sect2.para: mixed indicates that a parameter may accept multiple (but not necessarily all) types.
gettype for example will accept all PHP types, while str_replace will accept strings and arrays.

sect2.title: void
sect2.para: void as a return type means that the return value is useless. void in a parameter list means that the function doesn't accept any parameters. As of PHP 7.1 void is accepted as a function return type hint.
